title: Sight Singing Musical Theatre & Cabaret Rehearsal
description: Sight sing your favorite musical theatre harmonies, then rehearse for our Cabaret!
details: Join us for a fun session of sight singing where we’ll explore ensemble harmonies from well-loved musical theatre repertoire. Whether you’re new to sight singing or just want more practice, this is a great way to build confidence in a relaxed setting. Afterward, we’ll rehearse our group piece for the upcoming Cabaret, so come ready to sing, learn, and connect with others!

title: Bake Sale
description: Sign up for as many 30-minute shifts as you’d like, and/or bring baked goods to earn points!
details: ACDA will be hosting a Bake Sale to support our chapter!  We need volunteers to help at the table between 9:30 AM – 2:00 PM in 30-minute shifts. You can also contribute baked or store-bought items—donating or volunteering will help raise funds and increase your ACDA points total.

title: Treasures of Elementary Music
description: Understand the stigmas of Elementary Music and how we can combat them as choral direcotors and educators!
details: Elementary music often carries the stigma of children shouting songs out of tune or bands squeaking and honking out of tune. In this professional development session, John Wernega will share about his expansive experience as a elementary music director and inspire participants to consider the impact and value of elementary music teaching. He will focus on a few effective techniques, highlight the Head Start in Harmony initiative, and invite attendees to serve as helpers at the upcoming Elementary Festival.

title: Sight-Singing & Cabaret Rehearsal
description: Come read some scores and rehearse our group piece for cabaret!
details: Join us as we prepare for ACDA’s annual Cabaret! This rehearsal will focus on learning and polishing our group performance piece that we’ll showcase at the event. We will also have a quick Choral Show and Tell followed by some sight-singing! Hope to see you there!

title: Cabaret Virtual Auditions Due
description: Virtual Auditions for our annual Cabaret—any style, any act, all are welcome! Details Below!
details:
Our annual Cabaret is a fun, relaxed performance event that welcomes acts of all kinds—classical, musical theatre, instrumental, solos, duets, trios, and groups of any size! It’s a chance for students to share their talents in a supportive setting and enjoy a variety of performances in Boyd Recital Hall! We will have a piano accompanist for you to rehearse and perform with as well!

You can send your videos to rowanacda1@gmail.com! Email us either a Google Drive link or an unlisted YouTube link!

Feel free to email with any questions!

title: Bake Sale
description: Sign up for as many 30-minute shifts as you’d like, and/or bring baked goods to earn points!
details: ACDA will be hosting a Bake Sale to support our chapter!  We need volunteers to help at the table between 9:30 AM – 2:00 PM in 30-minute shifts. You can also contribute baked or store-bought items—donating or volunteering will help raise funds and increase your ACDA points total.

title: Church Gig 101
description: Learn the ins and outs of preparing for a church gig!
details: If you’ve ever wondered how church gigs work, this session is for you! We’ll cover the basics of sight singing, service structure, and professional etiquette, plus tips for success from those who’ve done it before. Whether you’re interested in picking up church jobs or want to strengthen your skills for future opportunities, you’ll leave with practical knowledge and confidence.

title: Cabaret Dress Rehearsal
description: Final run-through before Cabaret—polish your act and rehearse the group song together!
details: Our Cabaret Dress Rehearsal is the last opportunity for performers to run through their acts in full before the show. This rehearsal is designed to help you feel comfortable on stage, practice transitions, and receive any last-minute feedback. We’ll also take time to rehearse our group song together so everyone feels confident and performance-ready. It’s a supportive environment to fine-tune your work and make those final adjustments that will bring our annual Cabaret to life!

title: Cabaret
description: Don’t miss our annual Cabaret showcasing Rowan talent!
details: The Cabaret is one of our most anticipated events of the year, featuring performances from Rowan students. With a wide variety of music and styles, there’s something for everyone to enjoy. It’s an evening full of talent, energy, and community—come cheer on your peers and experience the magic of live performance!

title: Tenor Bass Festival
description: Volunteer to support the Tenor Bass Festival!
details: The Tenor|Bass Festival will bring hundreds of high school tenors and basses from three states together, uplifting voices, breaking barriers, celebrating the gift of singing, and uniting through music.

title: ACIT Workshop
description: Students from the Atlantic County Institute of Technology will join us for coachings from our vocal pedagogues!
details: Join us to gain insights on the development of high school vocal students. Students from ACIT will join us for coachings from our Students and to share insights on their experience studying classically in a high school setting.

title: Emily Dickinson in Art Song
description: Rowan students join renowned Lyric Fest artists for an evening of Emily Dickinson-inspired art song.

title: Concert Choir Concert
description: Hear Rowan’s Concert Choir in a powerful performance!
details: The Rowan University Concert Choir presents an evening of choral music that highlights both classic repertoire and exciting newer works. Known for their artistry and musical precision, the ensemble will showcase a diverse program under the direction of Dr. Thomas. Join us for a night of inspiring choral performance.

title: Pumpkin Painting & Root Beer Floats
description: Paint pumpkins and enjoy root beer floats at our fall collab event!
details: Celebrate the season with our NAfME x ACDA collaboration! Come relax, paint your own festive pumpkin, and sip on a classic root beer float while spending time with friends. It’s a cozy, creative way to get into the autumn spirit and take home something fun to brighten your space.

title: Bake Sale
description: Sign up for as many 30-minute shifts as you’d like, and/or bring baked goods to earn points!
details: ACDA will be hosting a Bake Sale to support our chapter!  We need volunteers to help at the table between 9:30 AM – 2:00 PM in 30-minute shifts. You can also contribute baked or store-bought items—donating or volunteering will help raise funds and increase your ACDA points total.

title: Learn Latin American Music
description: Discover and sing a beautiful piece of Latin American choral music.
details: This session is all about exploring the rich traditions of Latin American music. Together, we’ll learn about the composer and cultural background before bringing the music to life through singing. It’s a wonderful chance to broaden your repertoire, connect with new styles, and celebrate the diversity of choral traditions.

title: Collegium Musicum Fall Concert
description: Enjoy an early music concert featuring many of our members!
details: Collegium is an early music ensemble at Rowan University directed by Dr. Plant.

title: Choral Conducting 101
description: Learn the basics of choral conducting with a choir and accompaniment!
details: Ever wondered what it takes to lead a choir? Rowan ACDA will guide you through the fundamentals of choral conducting, from gestures and communication to rehearsal strategies. You’ll gain insight into what makes a conductor effective and even have the chance to try it yourself. Whether you see conducting in your future or just want to experience music from a new angle, this is a session you won’t want to miss.

title: Rowan Opera Company: Fall Opera Collage
description: Enjoy a collage of opera scenes performed by the Rowan Opera Company.
details: The Rowan Opera Company presents its annual Fall Opera Collage, a program filled with scenes and arias from across the operatic repertoire. Students will bring a wide variety of characters and stories to life in this dynamic and engaging performance. With two opportunities to attend, this is a perfect chance to experience the drama and beauty of opera in an intimate setting.

title: Rowan Opera Company: Fall Opera Collage
description: Enjoy a collage of opera scenes performed by the Rowan Opera Company.
details: The Rowan Opera Company presents its annual Fall Opera Collage, a program filled with scenes and arias from across the operatic repertoire. title: Rowan University Chorus & Voces Chamber Ensemble
description: Hear performances from both the Rowan University Chorus and the Voces Chamber Ensemble in one evening of diverse choral music.
details: This concert highlights two of Rowan’s vibrant choral ensembles in one program. The Rowan University Chorus will present a selection of larger choral works, while the Voces Chamber Ensemble will showcase more intimate repertoire written for smaller groups. Each ensemble brings its own unique sound and artistry, making for a dynamic and varied evening of music.

title: Bake Sale
description: Sign up for as many 30-minute shifts as you’d like, and/or bring baked goods to earn points!
details: ACDA will be hosting a Bake Sale to support our chapter!  We need volunteers to help at the table between 9:30 AM – 2:00 PM in 30-minute shifts. You can also contribute baked or store-bought items—donating or volunteering will help raise funds and increase your ACDA points total.

title: Mozart’s Requiem: Rowan University Concert Choir & Symphony Orchestra
description: Experience the power of Mozart’s Requiem performed by the Concert Choir and Symphony Orchestra.
details: The Rowan University Concert Choir and Symphony Orchestra come together for a performance of one of the most celebrated works in classical music: Mozart’s Requiem. This masterpiece, filled with drama, beauty, and emotional depth, remains one of Mozart’s most enduring legacies. Under the direction of Dr. Thomas, this collaboration promises to be a moving and unforgettable evening of music.

title: Conducting Workshop
description: Workshop your conducting skills with our ensemble!
details: Strengthen your conducting skills with our pianist and vocalists!

title: Libby Gopal
description: Join us and our guest clinician to develop your skills and explore some new and emerging works.
details:
Libby Gopal graduated from Penn State University with a B.S. in Music Education, her masters in music education from Westminster Choir College of Rider University, and a masters in school administration from Rowan University.

Mrs. Gopal served as a teacher trainer for the East Orange School District, was the 2021-2023 NJMEA Advocacy Chair, and served as NJ-ACDA Inclusivity Chair from 2017 until 2021 when she became NJ-ACDA President-Elect. She served on the ChorTeach editorial board from 2021-2023. Mrs. Gopal serves as the NJ-ACDA President and is the Visual & Performing Arts Supervisor for the East Windsor Regional School District.

description: Hear Rowan’s Concert Choir in a powerful performance!
details: The Rowan University Concert Choir presents an evening of choral music that highlights both classic repertoire and exciting newer works. Known for their artistry and musical precision, the ensemble will showcase a diverse program under the direction of Dr. Thomas. Join us for a night of inspiring choral performance.

title: Dr. Nick McBride
description: Join us and our guest clinician to develop your skills and explore some new and emerging works.
details:
Dr. McBride’s research interests include LGBTQIA+ and gender issues in music education, queer pedagogies and curricula, music teacher education, teacher evaluation, and empathic learning processes in music education. He is founder and principal conductor of the "This is Me" National Choral Festival for LGBTQIA+ youth and allies at Lincoln Center (2023) and Carnegie Hall (2025) and a Human Rights Campaign Welcoming Schools National Facilitator.

He earned Doctoral and Masters degrees in Music Education from Teachers College-Columbia University, New York; his dual Masters degrees with honors in Choral Conducting and Music Education from Northwestern University, Evanston, Illinois; and his Bachelor of Music Education from Westminster Choir College, Princeton, New Jersey.

title: Rodgers & Hammerstein's Cinderella
description: The original story of this beloved musical presented by the Department of Music and the Department of Theatre and Dance
details:
The original story of this beloved musical presented by the Department of Music and the Department of Theatre and Dance, featuring the Rowan University Symphony Orchestra.

*Please note that while children 12 and under can attend for free, they will require a ticket for admittance. Please select “Children 12 and Under” when choosing your ticket type. All children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult.
